00050 #ifdef Q_OS_WIN
00051 void setRTPriority()
00052 {
00053     Log() << "Setting process to realtime";
00054     if ( !SetPriorityClass(GetCurrentProcess(), REALTIME_PRIORITY_CLASS) ) 
00055         Error() << "SetPriorityClass() call failed: " << (int)GetLastError();    
00056 }
00057 double getTime()
00058 {
00059     static __int64 freq = 0;
00060     static __int64 t0 = 0;
00061     __int64 ct;
00062 
00063     if (!freq) {
00064         QueryPerformanceFrequency((LARGE_INTEGER *)&freq);
00065     }
00066     QueryPerformanceCounter((LARGE_INTEGER *)&ct);   // reads the current time (in system units)
00067     if (!t0) t0 = ct;
00068     return double(ct-t0) / double(freq);
00069 }
00070 #ifndef Q_WS_X11
00071 typedef BOOL (APIENTRY *wglswapfn_t)(int);
00072 void setVSyncMode()
00073 {
00074     stimApp()->glWin()->makeCurrent();
00075     wglswapfn_t wglSwapIntervalEXT = (wglswapfn_t)QGLContext::currentContext()->getProcAddress( "wglSwapIntervalEXT" );
00076     if( wglSwapIntervalEXT ) {
00077         wglSwapIntervalEXT(1);
00078         Log() << "VSync mode enabled using wglSwapIntervalEXT.";
00079     } else {
00080         Warning() << "VSync mode could not be enabled because wglSwapIntervalEXT is missing.";
00081     }
00082 }
00083 #endif
00084 #elif defined(Q_OS_LINUX)
00085 void setRTPriority()
00086 {
00087     if (geteuid() == 0) {
00088         Log() << "Running as root, setting priority to realtime";
00089         if ( mlockall(MCL_CURRENT|MCL_FUTURE) ) {
00090             int e = errno;
00091             Error() <<  "Error from mlockall(): " <<  strerror(e);
00092         }
00093         struct sched_param p;
00094         p.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_max(SCHED_RR);
00095         if ( sched_setscheduler(0, SCHED_RR, &p) ) {
00096             int e = errno;
00097             Error() << "Error from sched_setscheduler(): " <<  strerror(e);
00098         }
00099     } else {
00100         Warning() << "Not running as root, cannot set priority to realtime";
00101     }    
00102 }
00103 
00104 double getTime()
00105 {
00106         static double t0 = -9999.;
00107         struct timespec ts;
00108         clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &ts);
00109         double t = double(ts.tv_sec) + double(ts.tv_nsec)/1e9;
00110         if (t0 < 0.) t0 = t; 
00111         return t-t0;
00112 }
00113 #else /* !WIN and !LINUX */
00114 void setRTPriority()
00115 {
00116     Warning() << "Cannot set realtime priority -- unknown platform!";
00117 }
00118 #include <QTime>
00119 double getTime()
00120 {
00121     static QTime t;
00122     static bool started = false;
00123     if (!started) { t.start(); started = true; }
00124     return double(t.elapsed())/1000.0;
00125 }

00129 static const GLubyte *strChr(const GLubyte * str, GLubyte ch)
00130 {
00131     while (str && *str && *str != ch) ++str;
00132     return str;
00133 }
00134 
00135 static const char *gl_error_str(GLenum err)
00136 {
00137     static char unkbuf[64];
00138     switch(err) {
00139     case GL_INVALID_OPERATION:
00140         return "Invalid Operation";
00141     case GL_INVALID_ENUM:
00142         return "Invalid Enum";
00143     case GL_NO_ERROR:
00144         return "No Error";
00145     case GL_INVALID_VALUE:
00146         return "Invalid Value";
00147     case GL_OUT_OF_MEMORY:
00148         return "Out of Memory";
00149     case GL_STACK_OVERFLOW:
00150         return "Stack Overflow";
00151     case GL_STACK_UNDERFLOW:
00152         return "Stack Underflow";
00153     default:
00154         qsnprintf(unkbuf, sizeof(unkbuf), "UNKNOWN: %d", (int)err);
00155         return unkbuf;
00156     }
00157     return 0; // not reached
00158 }
00159 
00160 bool hasExt(const char *ext_name)
00161 {
00162     static const GLubyte * ext_str = 0;
00163 #ifdef Q_WS_X11
00164     static const char *glx_exts = 0;
00165     if (stimApp() && stimApp()->glWin()) stimApp()->glWin()->makeCurrent();
00166 #endif
00167     static const GLubyte space = static_cast<GLubyte>(' ');
00168     if (!ext_str) 
00169         ext_str = glGetString(GL_EXTENSIONS);
00170     if (!ext_str) {
00171         Warning() << "Argh! Could not get GL_EXTENSIONS! (" << gl_error_str(glGetError()) << ")";
00172     } else {
00173         const GLubyte *cur, *prev, *s1;
00174         const char *s2;
00175         // loop through all space-delimited strings..
00176         for (prev = ext_str, cur = strChr(prev+1, space); *prev; prev = cur+1, cur = strChr(prev, space)) {
00177             // compare strings
00178             for (s1 = prev, s2 = ext_name; *s1 && *s2 && *s1 == *s2 && s1 < cur; ++s1, ++s2)
00179                 ;
00180             if (*s1 == *s2 || (!*s2 && *s1 == space)) return true; // voila! found it!
00181         }
00182     }
00183 
00184 #ifdef Q_WS_X11
00185     if (!glx_exts) {
00186      // nope.. not a standard gl extension.. try glx_exts
00187      Display *dis;
00188      int screen;
00189 
00190      dis = XOpenDisplay((char *)0);
00191      if (dis) {
00192          screen = DefaultScreen(dis);
00193          const char * glx_exts_tmp = glXQueryExtensionsString(dis, screen);
00194          if (glx_exts_tmp)
00195              glx_exts = strdup(glx_exts_tmp);
00196          XCloseDisplay(dis);
00197      }
00198     }
00199      if (glx_exts) {
00200          const char *prev, *cur, *s1, *s2; 
00201          const char space = ' ';
00202          // loop through all space-delimited strings..
00203          for (prev = glx_exts, cur = strchr(prev+1, space); *prev; prev = cur+1, cur = strchr(prev, space)) {
00204         // compare strings
00205              for (s1 = prev, s2 = ext_name; *s1 && *s2 && *s1 == *s2 && s1 < cur; ++s1, ++s2)
00206             ;
00207              if (*s1 == *s2 ||  (!*s2 && *s1 == space)) return true; // voila! found it!
00208          }
00209      }
00210 #endif
00211     return false;
00212 }

00214 #ifdef Q_WS_X11
00215 void setVSyncMode()
00216 {
00217     if (hasExt("GLX_SGI_swap_control")) {
00218         Log() << "Found `swap_control' GLX-extension, turning on \"wait for vsync\"";
00219         int (*func)(int) = (int (*)(int))glXGetProcAddressARB((const GLubyte *)"glXSwapIntervalSGI");
00220         if (func) {
00221             func(1);
00222         } else
00223             Error() <<  "GLX_SGI_swap_control func not found!";
00224     } else
00225         Warning() << "Missing `swap_control' GLX-extension, cannot enable vsync!";           
00226 }
00227 #endif

00230 
00231 bool hasAccurateHWFrameCount()
00232 {
00233     if (fc_is_accurate < 0)  getHWFrameCount();
00234     return fc_is_accurate;

00237 #ifdef Q_OS_WIN
00238 unsigned getNProcessors()
00239 {
00240     static int nProcs = 0;
00241     if (!nProcs) {
00242         SYSTEM_INFO si;
00243         GetSystemInfo(&si);
00244         nProcs = si.dwNumberOfProcessors;
00245     }
00246     return nProcs;
00247 }
00248 #elif defined(Q_OS_LINUX)
00249 #include <unistd.h>
00250 unsigned getNProcessors()
00251 {
00252     static int nProcs = 0;
00253     if (!nProcs) {
00254         nProcs = sysconf(_SC_NPROCESSORS_ONLN);
00255     }
00256     return nProcs;
00257 }
00258 #elif defined(Q_OS_DARWIN)
00259 #include <CoreServices/CoreServices.h>
00260 unsigned getNProcessors() 
00261 {
00262     static int nProcs = 0;
00263     if (!nProcs) {
00264         nProcs = MPProcessorsScheduled();
00265     }
00266     return nProcs;
00267 }
00268 #else
00269 unsigned getNProcessors()
00270 {
00271     return 1;
00272 }

00276 #ifndef Q_OS_WIN /* GLX */
00277 unsigned getHWFrameCount()
00278 {
00279     static int (*func)(unsigned int *) = 0;
00280     static bool triedToFindFunc = false;
00281     if (!triedToFindFunc && !func) {
00282         triedToFindFunc = true;
00283         stimApp()->glWin()->makeCurrent();
00284         func = (int (*)(unsigned int *))QGLContext::currentContext()->getProcAddress( "glXGetVideoSyncSGI" );
00285         if (!func) {
00286             Error() << "No hw framecount func., will be emulated"; 
00287             fc_is_accurate = 0;
00288         } else
00289             fc_is_accurate = 1;
00290     }
00291     if (func) {
00292         unsigned int ret;
00293         func(&ret);
00294         return ret;
00295     }
00296     // otherwise emulated from the time and the HW refresh count -- note this may be off or drift because the system CPU clock is not necessarily synchronized to the video clock, right?
00297     return static_cast<unsigned>(getTime() * getHWRefreshRate()); 
00298 }
00299 #else /* WINDOWS */
00300 unsigned getHWFrameCount()
00301 {
00302     static BOOL (WINAPI *func)(HDC, INT64 *ust, INT64 *msc, INT64 *sbc) = 0;
00303     static bool triedToFindFunc = false;
00304     if (!triedToFindFunc && !func) {
00305         triedToFindFunc = true;
00306         stimApp()->glWin()->makeCurrent();
00307         func = (BOOL (WINAPI *)(HDC, INT64 *, INT64 *, INT64 *))QGLContext::currentContext()->getProcAddress( "wglGetSyncValuesOML" );
00308         if (!func) {
00309             Error() << "No hw framecount func., will be emulated"; 
00310             fc_is_accurate = 0;
00311         } else
00312             fc_is_accurate = 1;
00313     }
00314     if (func) {
00315         static INT64 f0 = 0;
00316         HDC hdc = wglGetCurrentDC();
00317         INT64 ust, msc, sbc;
00318         func(hdc, &ust, &msc, &sbc);
00319         if (!f0) f0 = msc;
00320         return msc-f0;
00321     }
00322     // otherwise emulated from the time and the HW refresh count -- note this may be off or drift because the system CPU clock is not necessarily synchronized to the video clock, right?
00323     return static_cast<unsigned>(getTime() * getHWRefreshRate()); 
00324 }
00325 #endif
00326 
00327 #ifdef Q_OS_WIN
00328 unsigned getHWRefreshRate() 
00329 { 
00330     unsigned rate = 0;
00331     //if (!rate) {
00332         HDC dc;
00333         bool defaultdc = false;
00334         if (stimApp() && stimApp()->glWin()) {
00335             dc = GetDC(stimApp()->glWin()->winId());
00336         } else {
00337             dc = CreateDCA( "DISPLAY", NULL, NULL, NULL );
00338             defaultdc = true; 
00339         }
00340         if (!dc) {
00341             Error() << "Could not create Win32 DC, getHWRefreshRate() will always return fake value of 120Hz!";
00342             rate = 120;
00343         } else {
00344             rate = GetDeviceCaps(dc, VREFRESH);
00345             //Debug() << "Windows reports HW refresh rate " << rate << "Hz";
00346         }
00347         if (defaultdc) {
00348             DeleteDC(dc);
00349         } else if (dc) {
00350             ReleaseDC(stimApp()->glWin()->winId(), dc);
00351         }
00352         //}
00353     return rate;
00354 }

00356 bool hasAccurateHWRefreshRate()
00357 {
00358     return true;

00362 // on linux we can't query the refresh rate so we have to just take the calibrated value
00363 unsigned getHWRefreshRate()
00364 {
00365     if (stimApp())
00366         return stimApp()->refreshRate();
00367     return 120;
00368 }

00385 void socketNoNagle(int sock)
00386 {
00387     BOOL flag = 1;
00388     int ret = setsockopt(sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, reinterpret_cast<char *>(&flag), sizeof(flag));
00389     if (ret) Error() << "Error turning off nagling for socket " << sock;
00390 }
00391 #else
00392 #  include <sys/socket.h>
00393 #  include <netinet/in.h>
00394 #  include <netinet/tcp.h>
00395 #  include <arpa/inet.h>
00396 void socketNoNagle(int sock)
00397 {
00398     long flag = 1;
00399     int ret = setsockopt(sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, reinterpret_cast<void *>(&flag), sizeof(flag));
00400     if (ret) Error() << "Error turning off nagling for socket " << sock;
00401 }
00402 #endif
